intro: Alsodeia johnstonei, commonly known as the Johnstone's alsodea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptations, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
